intro: Mapouria alba f. intermedia, commonly known as the white mapouria, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its large, white, showy flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it a striking appearance. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
